intro: Glomeraria viridis, commonly known as the green glomeraria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert scrub habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
